events.name: SIOS Technology Update
events.description:
SIOS Technology Update

Gain yourselves the competitive edge, come and learn from the specialists for -

High-availability & Disaster Recovery in the cloud, and on-premise - how you can now overcome the limitations to run SAN-less clustering for any application.

Machine Learning IT Analytics - How you can resolve issues and ensure optimum performance in your VM environments, through state-of-the-art AI Machine Learning automation.

SIOS Datakeeper/Protection Suite
High Availability & Disaster Recovery Failover¬†Clustering without the high-cost/hassle

The only block-level replication software that supports all environments including Windows and Linux, both on premise, Virtual Machine and in the cloud¬†
The only software that enables Windows clustering in the cloud through its clustering-integrated replication capabilities¬†
The only software that offers both Synchronous and Async replication for both Linux and Windows. Support multi-site failover clustering using just Standard Edition SQL server, instead of Enterprise Edition SQL resulting in 50% cost reduction¬†
Use Oracle Standard Edition with our software to gain high-availability, instead of Enterprise with RAC/Goldengate, at a fraction of the cost

SIOS iQ Machine Learning IT Analytics
More than just threshold monitoring/alert and dashboard, SIOS invented machine-learning technology that automatically "learns" your IT infrastructure behavior¬†

Performance root cause analysis for Instantaneous Issue Resolution
VMware vRealize Operations Manager 6.0 (vROps) Event Injection
Eliminate Wasted VM Resources
Capacity Forecasting - no need for manual threshold settings


Used by some of the most demanding enterprises in APAC including¬†- AGL Australia ‚Ä¢ China Airlines ‚Ä¢ Dept of Transport and Main Roads Australia ‚Ä¢ Inghams Group Australia ¬†‚Ä¢ Korea Education bureau ‚Ä¢ LG Display Korea ‚Ä¢ Mitsubishi Heavy Industries ‚Ä¢ NH Bank Korea ‚Ä¢¬† Nagaworld Casinos Cambodia ‚Ä¢ Nomura Research Institute (Shanghai) ‚Ä¢ Panasonic Asia ‚Ä¢ Razer Asia-Pacific Pte Ltd ‚Ä¢ Samsung Korea ‚Ä¢ Zespri New Zealand


Programme
¬†
9.00am Registration
9.30am Opening
9.45am HA & DR SANless Clustering Solution (Cloud and On-premise)
10.15am Demo
10.45am Q&A
11.00am Tea break
11.15am SIOS iQ Machine Learning IT Analytics for VM environments
11.30am Demo
11.45am Q&A
12.00pm Lucky Draw
12.15pm End
¬†
Refreshments will be served and prizes to be given away at the event, register early as seats are limited!

 RSVP Number: +65 9670 7089


You have received this message from Providence Solutions as a result of your participation in previous communications with us.

events.name: iOS Dev Scout March 2017 Meetup
events.description:
Venue: Singapore Power Ltd. 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #08-00 Keppel Tower 2 Singapore[masked] Speakers: ‚Ä¢ Madushan -¬†Software Engineer at Grab ‚Ä¢ Jojo -¬†Independent iOS App Developer Agenda: ‚Ä¢ 6:30pm: Come have some pizza (Sponsored by Singapore Power), say hello to other iOS devs¬† ‚Ä¢ 7:15pm:¬†Is your app diverse enough? - by¬†Madushan ‚Ä¢ 7:45pm:¬†iOS App Development: from Idea to AppStore - by Jojo ‚Ä¢¬†8:15pm: Show & Tell, quiz with vouchers to be won! About the Topics: ‚Ä¢ Madushan will share his experience on¬†how you can benefit from iOS customisations to reach a more diverse user base. He has previously shared on the topic iOS Accessibility. ‚Ä¢ Jojo will share on the topic 'iOS App Development: from Idea to AppStore', giving a walkthrough of what you need to know to release an app in the AppStore. 

About iOS Conf SG 2016: iOS Conf SG is an annual iOS conference organised by us. Last year's conference was on the 20th and 21st of October @ Nanyang Polytechnic and it concluded with an amazing turn out, garnering raving responses and feedback from both the speakers and attendees. For more information, visit our iOS Dev Scout Group and iOS Conf SG Page: iOS Conf SG Website:¬†http://iosconf.sg iOS Conf SG 2016 Videos:¬†https://engineers.sg/conference/iosconfsg2016 iOS Conf SG Facebook Page:¬†https://www.facebook.com/iosconfsg/ iOS Dev Scout Facebook Group:¬†https://www.facebook.com/groups/iosdevscout/
events.location: Singapore Power, 240 Tanjong Pagar, Keppel Towers 2, Level 08

events.name: Metrics Driven DevOps
events.description: Hi there, Here we go again. This month we will have a presentation on Metrics and another one on CI/CD . Hope to see you all there. Pizza and beers from 6.30pm onwards. First talk - 7.00pm Metrics Driven DevOps: Continuously Delivery High Quality Software. By Myrvin from Dynatrace. Becoming the next Uber is only possible if you deliver what your users want faster than others. Some aspects of DevOps, implementing Continuous Delivery & Feedback Loops and the flexibility that a platform like Cloud Foundry provides are a perfect combination to get closer to that goal. Myrvin is part of a team of Sales Engineers in Dynatrace, ASEAN. He is passionate about how technology shapes human behaviour and has helped many organisations drive the adoption of application performance engineering in Dynatrace. He draws his inspiration from Mozart, Tchaikovsky and Rachmaninoff, and might be spotted conducting a virtual orchestra from time to time. ‚ÄãMyrvin's Linkedin Page‚Äã: https://www.linkedin.com/in/myrvin-yap-04780964/ (https://www.linkedin.com/in/myrvin-yap-04780964/) Second talk - 8.00pm Overview of container platforms from a development perspective. By Vincent Serpoul from Manulife.
events.location: Microsoft Asia Pacific, 1 Marina Boulevard #22-00 22CF-12, Singapore

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Natasha Low, GovTech
events.description: Hey everyone! This March, we'll be speaking with Natasha Low from GovTech (Government Technology Agency of Singapore) to learn more about her journey and how UX Design is being done in this newly formed government agency.¬†  About Natasha Low Natasha Low leads a UX team in GovTech‚Äôs Government Digital Services Division. A key objective of the team is to advocate the importance of user experience in the public sector. Natasha has assisted various government agencies in their digital transformation journey, which ranges from user research activities to usability testing. Her past experience as an interaction designer and lecturer has helped Natasha build up her facilitation and design research skills, which she applies to crafting delightful experiences for citizens, one digital service at a time. Agenda for the night¬† 7pm ‚Äì 7.30pm: Registration, drinks, snacks and networking¬†7.30pm ‚Äì 8.30pm: Conversation with Natasha ¬†8.30pm ‚Äì 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. The value of the meetup is as good as the questions asked :) Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at¬†kiat@ixda.sg¬†and I'll ask them on your behalf :)¬†Alternatively, you may like to tweet us the questions to¬†@IxDASG¬†and we can have that answered! Special thanks to The Co for sponsoring the venue!
events.location: The Co, Duxton, 99 Duxton Road, Singapore 089543

events.name: TechLadies Study CS50 - Week 0 to 2 Again!
events.description:
Join us in this women-only study group to learn computer science! While there will be one or two mentors to help all of us out, you need to be self-reliant as much as possible as this is not a workshop. 

In this study group, we are taking the course, HarvardX: CS50 Introduction to Computer Science, on edX together. As long as you are taking this course, please join us even if you're just getting started! üë©üèª‚Äçüíª üí™

To join in this study group, please:

1. Create an account on edX and enroll into the course at this link: https://courses.edx.org/courses/course-v1:HarvardX+CS50+X/info

2. Start from Week 0 or continue where you've left off, up to level 2! We will work on the problem sets when we meet.  

Bring your fully charged laptop and we'll see you soon!

Note: Please buy something at the cafe as we're merely crashing that cafe. We don't want to be kicked out!

Psst! This study group is for women only. :)
events.location: Mellower Coffee Singapore, 108 Middle Road, The Prospex #01-01 188967

events.name: Elm Singapore March Meetup
events.description: This Month we have the good fortune to be hosted by the mobile app development company buUuk ! Last time we started to build the Elm Singapore Feedback Timer application, and made it through some View code and added basic page flow. This time the plan is to continue this and start looking at subscribtions and interop with JS. You can see the progress we made the last time here. The plan is to start with networking and snacks (see the question below)¬† and the move on to the interactive coding part. Don't forget that you can join the preparation chatter on the Elm Slack Singapore Channel (get access here) or by starting a discussion here on the Meetup. Looking forward to seeing you there!
events.location: buUuk Pte Ltd, 41 Tembeling Road, Singapore

events.name: Why Developing with Couchbase is Easy!!
events.description:
Agenda: 1. Introduction to Couchbase Data Platform 2. What is new Couchbase Server 4.6 & Couchbase Mobile 1.4 ? 3. How to create, read, update, and delete JSON documents, serialized in the client as POJOs using synchronous Couchbase Java SDK 2.x API calls, including the new N1QL query API 4. Demo 



Speaker: Karthik Sekar: Karthik is a "Solutions Architect, Worldwide Field Operations" at Couchbase and has over 15 years of total experience and over 5 years of expertise in Big Data and NoSQL technologies, Cloud and Distributed computing platforms, experience in setting up, configuring, securing, tuning multi petabyte Hadoop clusters and architecting and delivering large NoSQL database solutions on Couchbase & Cassandra.
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: Discussion and Open space for Emerging Big data and Analytics Technologies
events.description: Agenda : 7:00 PM : Networking and Discussion 7:30 PM : Discussion on Emerging OLTP Databases on top of Hadoop and its future 8:00 PM : Breakout session 9:00 PM : END and BYE BYE

events.name: GA x NTUC: So You Want To Be A Product Manager
events.description:
RSVP for free here: bit.ly/2lfl0Fz

Considering a career as a Product Manager? Curious about what a day-to-day job in product management looks like? Join General Assembly and NTUC to learn about what a day in the life entails for a product manager.

Hear from a panel of product managers as they tell all about about their professional experience in product management to see what it's like to work as a product manager. We will explore different options for branching into Product Management and discuss how Product Managers are found and hired. We will also talk about the expectations you can have throughout your career and key areas of growth within the industry.

Join us and get acquainted with the field of Product Management in Singapore.
